fields.description:
h2. Summary
A customer's pull request's "Files changed" view doesn't load on Bitbucket Cloud.

h2. Workaround
* Click "Activity" tab
* Then go back and click "Overview" tab

h2. Investigation
* Per checking, the PR has 58 file changes.
* Some files won't show because and receive the message: "Oops! You've got a lot of code in this diff and it couldn't load with the page"
fields.summary: Pull requests Files changed view does not load

fields.description:
Trying to compare tags or non-{{master}} branches results in an empty response, e.g. "No commits to display." or "There are no merged pull requests."

The URLs for these failed comparisons look like this:

.../branches/compare/tag-1.2.3%0Dtag-1.2.4\\
.../branches/compare/branch-1.2.x%0Dbranch-1.3.x\\
.../branches/compare/tag-1.2.3%0Dbranch-1.3.x

If either of the fields references a commit or {{master}}, the comparisons work as expected.

The raw git commands, e.g. {{git diff tag-1.2.3 tag-1.2.4}}, show the expected unified diff output.
fields.summary: `/compare/branches` only works for comparisons involving `master` or a commit

fields.description:
h3. Description
The diff view for Jupyter Notebook files (.ipynb) does not render and previsualize the diff, instead it shows the JSON, JS, etc, contents of the notebook.

In other previews in Bitbucket, of entire files -- not diffs-, notebooks are rendered and previsualized.

h3. Proposal
I propose to to use the nbdime tool to render previsualize diffs of notebooks.

h3. Links / references
* http://nbdime.readthedocs.io/en/stable/
* https://twitter.com/betatim/status/996328764622692352
fields.summary: Preview diff for notebooks

fields.description:
This issue appears to me as a not resolved.

Currently, relative links work only within {{master}} branch.

E.g.

# I have a {{documentation}} branch, where I just introduced new images. There were no images in commits tree previously.
# I committed my changes, but all images appears to be broken.
# I have {{<doc1>}} commit hash in my documentation branch and {{<master1>}} in my master branch.
# All rendered images links in documentation branch should be pointing to raw {{<doc1>}} commit hash. But NO!\\
They are pointing to raw {{<master1>}} commit hash. Which isn't a proper behavior.

Summary:\\
It is necessary to render image links according to a branch where the changes are made.\\
But not from master branch permanently.

Similar issues:

* BCLOUD-6315
* BCLOUD-15949
fields.summary: Relative links in markdown files always resolve to main branch

fields.description:
With the New Source Browser beta feature enabled, users are not able to see the option to clone from Bitbucket Mirror. Disabling this beta feature is the current workaround to have that option.

*Workaround*

# Navigate to Bitbucket Settings >> Labs
# Disable the feature "New Source Browser experience by clicking the slider
# Refresh the repository and click "Overview" tab  and you should be able to see the option to select Bitbucket Mirror.
fields.summary: Option to clone from mirror not visible with New Source Browser feature enabled

fields.summary: Blame button seems to be missing

fields.description:
Annotate (previouslyu called Blame) view shows a left side bar with committers names, commit hashes and dates.

Names have a tooltip for the committers name (seems redundant), dates have tooltips showing the full date with time, but hashes show no extra information.

The hashes are colored (useful indeed), and are themselves links to the corresponding commits, but it would be very useful if hovering over each hash's link would show the corresponding commit message, allowing us to quickly know them instead of having to click on them and then going back and forth.

For sources with tons of commits, its a pain to track commit messages in the file's source view (blame). Showing the tooltips (or some other way to see commit messages within that view) would provide very useful information to understand changes made in a single file, without having to jump to actual commit views.
fields.summary: In annotate view, links of commit hashes should show a tooltip with each commit's message

fields.description: GitLab includes the facility to import not only repositories, but their associated issue boards and settings from Bitbucket, GitHub and others. Having this functionality on Bitbucket would more easily enable developers to switch their projects to it.
fields.summary: Import entire projects from other cloud git hosting providers

fields.description:
For caches, it would be be really good to implement:

Dependent CPAN builds

Debian packages
fields.summary: Cache Debian and Perl dependencies by default

fields.description:
Caches currently live for 7 days, and are only invalidated at the end of the 7 days. Updates to dependencies do not cause the cache to be refreshed which means that builds can sometimes use old versions of dependencies, leading to downstream errors.

Ideally, caches will be refreshed when build dependencies are updated.
fields.summary: Refresh caches when dependencies are updated

fields.description:
With the beta feature "New Source  Browser" enabled, and the repository is being watched, commit notification is not being sent out.

!3551092741-1.PNG|thumbnail!

However, after disabling this feature, and navigating to Repository Overview >> Click watch the repository, and select "Commits", you will be able to receive the commits notification. (After doing this, enabling the New Source Browser and you will be able to receive commit notification)

!3997245120-2.PNG|thumbnail!

_Workaround_

# Navigate to Bitbucket Settings >> Labs
# Disable the feature "New Source Browser experience
# Refresh the repository and click "Overview" tab
# Click the drop down arrow next to the "eye" logo on the right hand side of the page
# Select "Watch This Repository" and check the boxes for the features you would like to receive notifications for.
fields.summary: Unable to receive commit notification email with New Source Browser feature enabled.

Click the checkbox "Close source branch"

Can we configure those settings by default?

fields.description:
It would be useful to access change history for Environment Variables for Pipelines.

At the moment there is no visibility of changes made to the Environment Variables.

This is particularly an issue at the moment due to how easy it is to accidentally delete Environment Variables (see Issues 15940 & 16002).\\
If there was visibility of change history, it would make it easier to determine which Env Var was accidentally been deleted, particularly when a repository has a large number of Environment Variables (I have accidentally deleted Env Vars quite a few times and not even realized which one I deleted).

Implementation of this enhancement, enhancement BCLOUD-16300 and issue BCLOUD-15940 would improve the user experience of Pipelines Environment Variables.
fields.summary: Pipelines Environment Variables - View Change History

fields.description:
It would be really useful to be able to import/export Environment Variables for Pipelines.

It would be particularly useful when there are lots of Environment Variables for a repository.

This would also be useful due to the lack of visibility of the history of Environment Variables and how easy it is to accidentally delete Environment Variables (see Issues 15940 & 16002).

Assumptions\\
It should NOT be possible to export the value for any secured Env Vars.\\
It SHOULD be possible to specify if an Environment Variable should be secured when uploading/importing.\\
It should NOT be possible to upload duplicate Environment Variables.

Implementation of this enhancement, enhancement BCLOUD-16301 and issue BCLOUD-15940 would improve the user experience of Pipelines Environment Variables.
fields.summary: Pipelines Environment Variables - Import/Export Variables

fields.description:
When opening the "Branches" page in Bitbucket it's possible to filter the branches by "Active" and "Merged".

It's possible to check only one of those at a time, it's not possible to check all branches at the same time.

So the proposition here is to allow users to filter by "All" branches in Bitbucket Cloud.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Filtering branches doesn't allow to check both active and merged branches at the same time

fields.description:
I use webhooks to run tasks in Jenkins. Since yesterday, webhooks have stopped working correctly. For any events in the Bitbucket - a new commit or even the creation and removal of brunch comes webhook, which will be triggered by all the tasks that are tied to this brunch and which have status.

Example, I removed branch and log in jenkins is:

May 16, 2018 1:19:36 AM com.cloudbees.jenkins.plugins.BitbucketJobProbe triggerMatchingJobs\\
INFO: Triggering BitBucket job Effie_WebServer_K8S_DEV\\
May 16, 2018 1:19:36 AM com.cloudbees.jenkins.plugins.BitbucketJobProbe triggerMatchingJobs\\
INFO: Triggering BitBucket job Effie_WebServer_K8S_TEST\\
May 16, 2018 1:19:36 AM com.cloudbees.jenkins.plugins.BitbucketJobProbe triggerMatchingJobs\\
INFO: Triggering BitBucket job Effie_WebServer_Retail_DEMO\\
May 16, 2018 1:19:38 AM com.cloudbees.jenkins.plugins.BitBucketTrigger$1 run\\
INFO: SCM changes detected in Effie_WebServer_K8S_DEV. Triggering BCLOUD-19\\
May 16, 2018 1:19:38 AM com.cloudbees.jenkins.plugins.BitBucketTrigger$1 run\\
INFO: SCM changes detected in Effie_WebServer_K8S_TEST. Triggering BCLOUD-15

Why were the jobs Effie_WebServer_K8S_DEV and Effie_WebServer_K8S_TEST triggered, they should have been ignored!!!!\\
Everything worked before!

I need help!
fields.summary: after 14 may 2018 Bitbucket webhooks triger worked incorectly

fields.description:
We have started using webhooks instead of polling from Jenkins and it proved to be a massive improvement. However, many of our team members would like to be able to set up their project but cannot because they are not administrator of their repository. Corporate rules prevent us from adding everyone as an admin.

It would be nice to have a separate permission allowing users with write access to the repository to add and configure webhooks
fields.summary: Allow team members to manage webhooks, without being administrators

fields.description:
As a Bitbucket admin we should be able to control permissions over file/folder for any individual user or group.

Example, I have a dev group who should be able to commit on the repository but not on some configuration folder to avoid issues.
fields.summary: Bitbucket admin should be able to control permissions over file/folder

fields.description:
Having a [default merge strategy|BCLOUD-13895] is a great start, but we need to be able to set it per branch for it to be really useful.

I suggest to set the merge strategy for a target branch. For our feature branches merged into a dev branch we want to squash all commits. But for the dev -> master merge we do not want to squash but keep dev and master branch exact replicas.
fields.summary: Set default merge strategy per branch

go to Avatar -> Bitbucket Labs -> and turn off "New source browser experience BETA".
fields.summary: Accessing Source view with the new UI times out for large repositories (BBCDEV-9988)

fields.description:
I'm currently trying to use Pipelines to build a Singularity container (https://singularity.lbl.gov/docs-build-container) which will later either be pushed or a remote server or available as a download. I have a Docker image I'm using a build environment, however the when the step comes to build the Singularity container an error is thrown:

{code}
+ singularity build shiny.img shiny.def
Using container recipe deffile: shiny.def
Sanitizing environment
ERROR : Could not virtualize mount namespace: Operation not permitted
ABORT : Retval = 255
Cleaning up...
{code}

Apparently the way around this to run Docker with the {{--privileged}} flag (see https://github.com/singularityware/singularity/issues/632#issuecomment-296545074). After having spoken with support it's come to my attention this is currently impossible with Pipelines (see https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/run-docker-commands-in-bitbucket-pipelines-879254331.html). It would be useful to have this option available for builds in which it is required.

* https://singularity.lbl.gov/docs-build-container
* https://github.com/singularityware/singularity/issues/632
fields.summary: Make it possible to user Docker images with --privileged flag

fields.description: When trying to perform a global NPM install in Pipelines using the atlassian/default-image:2 image, the build will fail with a "sh: 1: node: Permission denied" error.
fields.summary: The atlassian/default-image:2 image will result in a Permission denied when performing a global NPM install

fields.description:
There are essentially two requests here:

* Allow users that are not using a new feature to hide the constant notifications (acceptable notification count: 1)
* Never send notifications to users that are using a new feature (acceptable notification count: 0)

Continuing to notify users about a feature they’re already using is a bug and should be resolved soon as possible.
fields.summary: Continuing to notify users about a feature they’re already using.(BBS-78031)

Markdown render issue

fields.summary: Ability to add secret fields to webhooks

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When I invite a new user to my repository > Settings > User and group access.\\
The new user receives the invitation email.\\
When the new user accepts the invitation, it allows the new user to signup on id.atlassian.com.\\
However, it only allows the new user to signup on id.atlassian.com, there's no redirect or options for the new user to signup for Bitbucket.org.

The tendency is that I will need to ask the new user to signup to Bitbucket.org manually and re-add the new user to the repository group based on the new user's created username.

h3. How to Replicate
# Invite a new user to a repository
# Accept the invitation via email
# Sign up to id.atlassian.com (from the invitation email)
# Verify the email sent via email (from id.atlassian.com)

h3. Workaround
Ask a new user to signup to id.atlassian.com and bitbucket.org first before inviting to the repository.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Invitation Email doesn't allow signup to Bitbucket (Only on AID)

If I have many open PRs to review, some may be hidden behind a "Show XX more" link.\\
This obscures PRs that I may not have got around to reviewing.\\
Since the point of the overview page appears to be "Your Work" it makes sense to display as prominently as possible work that still needs to be done.
fields.summary: as a user I would like to see my unapproved PRs sorted to the top of "Pull requests to review" list

fields.description:
Originally from a comment on BCLOUD-15978 (possibly related):

bq. We've had this but also unrelated to pull requests, mainly email notifications with the wrong user listed as the author (but with the correct author in the details list of commits).


bq. I've seen it happen in:


bq. * Recent activity on the bitbucket project overview (on a branch where there was no PR and the user mentioned as the author did not work on that branch at all)


* PR update email notifications
* Pipelines failed email notifications

bq. Other strange points when this happens: When notifications use the wrong user they always use the same wrong user (one of our team members, say A) So far I've only seen the commits from 2 team members (say B and C) affected with this (they both look like they're from the member A), it does not trigger for other people


bq. As a result those 2 team members (B and C) get notifications for their on updates to their PRs (normally not sent) since the email thinks A did the update (even though the commits belong to B or C)
fields.summary: Wrong user displayed in some notifications and activity feed

fields.description:
While working with bit-bucket, if the user changes his PC date/time to a future date and then does a commit, the commit uses user's PC date/time instead of a cloud date/time.\\
Later while reviewing the list of commits, one can see strange date entries in the version history with words like 'Tomorrow' appearing in the version history.\\
(See attached screen-shot)

Steps to reproduce:

# Change local PC date/time to the next day
# Perform a code check-in
# Restore PC time to current date/time
# Review version history in bitbucket. You will notice 'Tomorrow' against the check-in done

Possible resolution:\\
Check-ins should be time-stamped ith cloud sourced time reference instead of time reference from user's PC
fields.summary: Bitbucket timestamps code check-ins using user's PC Date/Time instead of using its own time reference from cloud

fields.description:
Hi

The function 'Clone in Xcode' does not work.

I go to my repository, press the 'Clone', then in the 'Pop-up' I select 'Clone in XCode', XCode start and I change to 'user name password' but th uthentication fails

See attached screenshot
fields.summary: Cannot clone repository to XCode

fields.description: Can not scroll the search results on iOS. Chrome or safari.
fields.summary: Code search results not scrollable on mobile

fields.description: Related to BCLOUD-12821 there is an need to queue builds so that publishing to Nexus of snapshots and artifacts happens in a predictable way.
fields.summary: Build concurrency control for non-deployment steps
Missing font part between baseline and descender line in pull request list

fields.description: The sync option to synchronize a fork with the main repository or other repositories is missing. Hence a fork is never able to get the latest code from the master repository.
fields.summary: Sync between forks

fields.description:
Hi,

When we clone our repository we get a refs error.

coins@VM-ukazux01:/u/git$ git clone *git@bitbucket.org:coinsoa/coins.git* /u/git/coinsrelease2   Cloning into '/u/git/coinsrelease2'...\\
*error: refs/heads/v11.08/olekri/d17756a_missing_timecard_rep does not point to a valid object!*\\
remote: Counting objects: 565083, done.\\
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (123898/123898), done.\\
Receiving objects: 100% (565083/565083), 453.15 MiB | 18.24 MiB/s, done.\\
remote: Total 565083 (delta 440613), reused 565041 (delta 440597)\\
Resolving deltas: 100% (440613/440613), done.\\
Checking out files:  67% (162413/242406)

This also happens on pull.

coins@VM-ukazux01:/u/git/coinsrelease2$ git pull\\
error: refs/heads/v11.08/olekri/d17756a_missing_timecard_rep does not point to a valid object!\\
remote: error: refs/heads/v11.08/olekri/d17756a_missing_timecard_rep does not point to a valid object!

When we visit out commits and branches pages on BitBucket, it displays the 'Something went wrong' page.

Yesterday our repo's size was reduced and a lot of garbage was deleted (*BBS-78384*), not sure if this has caused the issue.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Clone Repository refs error

fields.description: I've removed the staging deployment from bitbucket-pipelines.yml and it's still showing up in deployments. It would be nice to be able to remove/hide it completely.
fields.summary: Delete A Deployment Stage

fields.description:
Hello,\\
I am using the {{Releases}} in Jira for the First time.

I have added 3 issues to a release. One of the issue is marked as Done but when I open the Releases, it shows under {{Issues in Progress}} with Status marked as Done\\
I anticipated that it will show up under {{Issues Done}}
fields.summary: Issue marked as Done is not shown as Done in Releases

fields.description: Let us option to change pipeline to hold/pause so it won't run until status is changed to run.
fields.summary: Put pipeline on hold/pause

fields.description: In profile view - can you create a Recent Activity section w/ configurable time periods so I can see more than what is currently shown
fields.summary: Recent Activity

fields.description:
[Environment] Windows 10, Microsoft Edge 41.16299.248.0

[Hardware] Surface Pro 4, scrolling using touchpad or touchscreen

[Bitbucket Lab] "New source browser experience" turned on

[Reproduce]

# Go to any repository, and choose to view a source file (.cpp for example) which is longer than that a screen could contain.
# Try to scroll down with touchpad or touchscreen (since I do not own a mouse, I can't say for mouse scrolling)

[Behavior] Code view not scrolling down even when cursor is inside the viewing box. Rather the whole page has the tendency to move.\\
[Expected Behavior] Code view scrolls down normally as before.
fields.summary: Cannot scroll when viewing source code in "New source browser experience" mode

fields.description:
Hi,

so basically the exact issue described here\\
BCLOUD-13919 and that was silently closed

*Documentation followed:*

https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/deploy-build-artifacts-to-bitbucket-downloads-872124574.html

*Current setup:*

* member of a team
* created a repository (team is owner of it, I am "rlaurent-de" also Admin)
* created an app password for my account "rlaurent-de"
* unable to use this app password to upload content, always getting a 401 from api.bitbucket.org

* tried in bitbucket pipelines and also tried with curl from my laptop

*Extra info:*

End of 2017 I configured two such pipelines and everything was working correctly, I've rerun one of them today (2018/05/08) and the build went fine *with old app token generated in 2017*

Out of curiosity I only regenerated their app token and redefined env variable of pipeline and now everything is broken with a 401 Unauthorized as described above ... (and I'm absolutely positive those were app token linked to my account, not a team account; I've deleted it and recreated in the same screen then updated the environment variables of the pipeline)

Thanks in advance for the time taken
fields.summary: Deploy build artifacts to Bitbucket Downloads broken with Unauthorized 401 status code

fields.description:
With new source browser beta version, i am unable to view some SQL files and these are showing as some ? marks like below...

��

But after disabling this feature, i am able to see the file correctly. Can you please find out where the issue is.
fields.summary: Seems issue with new source browser beta version while viewing SQL files

fields.description:
[The support account suggested|https://twitter.com/AskAtlassian/status/991344365762052096] to create a feature request to have AppleScript added to the list of languages, one can choose for a repository. The list I'm talking about: _repository_ > Settings > Repository details, and then Language-dropdown.

I'm not sure what kind of functionality is behind an item in the list. For me it would be nice to distinguish between Python and AppleScript repositories.

As an extra argument to add AppleScript; I made a filter so one can use AppleScript more easy with git: [https://github.com/doekman/osagitfilter]
fields.summary: Add AppleScript as repository language choice

fields.description:
We noticed new update on the interface. Markdown preview now show links to users, if your text has structures like "@sometext".\\
It's really confusing, because we see some strange users, which we don't know, which never joined private repository.

Original source:\\
http://prntscr.com/jdkd18\\
Preview:\\
http://prntscr.com/jdkdb7

Because of NDA we can't print full usernames, so we use just 2 letters of first/last name. And they do not correspond any real users. But now this new preview confuse all our company members, who use git.

* I wrote to support already and they answered, that I should raise a ticket here.
fields.summary: Markdown file previews with user mentions works wrong
I'm trying to implement the Bitbucket oauth in Node JS. But I need to know how can we use refresh token?

fields.description:
As a user, it's necessary sometimes to check if there was a change in the repository name by one of its users.

It should be possible to check Bitbucket's audit log for repository name changes for administrative reasons.

This feature should help a lot of people to better control their repo, and there's no actual downside to knowing this information, at least as far as i'm concerned.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Add name changes to audit log

fields.description:
Since today all our pipeline builds are failing in the Build Setup step.

{code}
#!bash

+ hg clone --noupdate https://x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/... . && hg update -C "1948a0c3f62d0c14c701564f6ed83fc7ce28875a"
applying clone bundle from https://api.media.atlassian.com/file/BLA/binary?token=XXX&client=BLA
adding changesets
adding manifests
adding file changes
added 48177 changesets with 158656 changes to 22304 files (+154 heads)
finished applying clone bundle
searching for changes
abort: HTTP Error 400: Bad Request
{code}
fields.summary: Build setup fails with HTTP 400 in hg clone step

fields.description: I've got an issue with viewing anything on the pull request page. The pull request page keeps refreshing. I can't even cancel the PR. This is not the only time I came across the problem.
fields.summary: Can't view pull request, page keeps refreshing

fields.description:
In the pull request page I'd like to be able to enter a git commit hash in the search box and find any pull requests that included this commit (whether open, merged or declined).

This is very useful for looking at any discussion that took place during the code review to understand why something was done a certain way in the commit.

It would also be good if the API allowed finding pull requests for a given commit.
fields.summary: Allow finding pull request by commit hash

Bitbucket (Commit view)

show attached photo as small grid and when click on any photo it open in larger view

but it's view should be small like 40% of it's size to enable user to have a look to as much as possible photo without long scrolling.

thanks a lot <3
fields.summary: on Commit comments': show attached photos as small grid

They are still showing up in my repo list, and I cannot create projects under the same name. Is there anyway to remove them? Thanks!
fields.summary: deleted repo still showing up in my project list

fields.description:
The guide on closing commits via issue reference does not mention any policy about white spaces.\\
And I was quite surprised to find\\
{{fixesbug BCLOUD-11}}, {{fixes bug#11}} and {{fixes bug BCLOUD-11}}, all three work the same

I think it would be useful to mention these on the documentation and also prevent {{fixesbug BCLOUD-11}}. The rest two still make sense to keep but this one is completely reader un-friendly.
fields.summary: Issue referencing on Bitbucket Cloud

However if I am on a wiki directory like {{/wiki/browse/{directory}}} and click *Create page* I am moved to the page {{/wiki/create/{directory}}} and have plain _content_ field in one line like a _title_ field.

fields.description:
Hi

in the past design of bitbucket each fork was showing a "out of sync" status, something like, "three commits behind" and it was possible to introduce the sync to the master repository by a click on the web site "sync now".\\
Currently I don't see any information in the fork that pull requests were merged and the fork branch is out of date. Without this information it is a bit pointless to work together by using forks.

Please, can we have back this status and action.

regards\\
Reimar Bauer
fields.summary: sync status on fork is missing

fields.description:
When an API call results have more than 1 page  , clicking "next page" URL returns that is not valid and will not produce the result for the second page.

As a workaround, you can specify the length with the request URL to get more results per page, example:

https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/account/repo_slug/pipelines_config/variables/?pagelen=20&page=1
fields.summary: API call to any end point with multiple pages doesn't return valid NEXT page link to follow
